citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Moored Sediment Trap Data - Station P, 1982-1999
citeinfo.othercit: Publications: Wong, C.S., F.A. Whitney, D.W. Crawford, K. Iseki, R.J. Matear, W.K. Johnson, J.S. Page, D. Timothy. 1999. Seasonal and interannual variability inparticle fluxes of carbon, nitrogen, and silicon from time series of sediment traps at Ocean Station P, 1982-1993: relationship to changes in subarctic primary productivity. Deep-Sea Research II 46: 2735-2760.

descript.abstract: Time series sediment trap data from 1982-1999 from traps moored at Ocean Station Papa , at one intermediate station (Station C, 1984-1990) and at 4 stations along Line P, from 200, 1000, and 3800m depths.
descript.purpose: Studying the biogeochemical flux at ocean station papa.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years) Impact of Loss: High Recommended Action: Bring data to archives Additional Info: Station P4 is at La Perouse.

idinfo.useconst: Data before 1994 have been published and can be released. Data after 1994 have not been released. Fe/Al/Cd data have not been quality checked, and therefore are not to be released.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of one sample, collected at P26, are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity. Zooplankton that likely swam into the trap are removed. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Many gaps in the data due to malfunctioning equipment or difficulty retrieving the traps. Traps were deployed at stations P12, P16, and P20 from 1995-1998 only.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS Hardcopy Description: Binders of data sheets Hardcopy Volume: about 4 2in. binders Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1411, IOS Physical Sample Volume: several hundred Physical Sample Description: Vials of dried sediment in various formats: some are on filters, some are not. Physical Sample Complications: Early samples were poorly labelled; it may be difficult to determine their origin.Some of the early biogenic silicate fractions were poorly labelled (several hundred).

stdorder.ordering: Electronic Data Doc Locations: Column headings in spreadsheet Dataset Locations: IOS Climate chemistry shared hard drive

distinfo.techpreq: Backup by Custodian: Y Backup by Automation: Y Backup Description: 3 1/2 in. disks in binders containing data sheets.
